intro: Castilleja angustifolia var. adenophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange tubular flowers. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for water and nutrients, making it a partial parasite. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
